paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient was diagnosed with ATTR-CA at age 75.

individual_records.phenotype_details: Cardiac amyloidosis with preserved ejection fraction
individual_records.evidence_sentence: The patient presented with symptoms at age 65.

individual_records.phenotype_details: No symptoms despite carrying the variant
individual_records.evidence_sentence: This individual remains asymptomatic at age 72.

functional_data.summary: The Val40Met variant is associated with destabilization of the TTR protein leading to amyloid deposition.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families with a history of amyloidosis.
variants.population_frequency: Rare in general population, higher in specific ethnic groups.
variants.additional_notes: The variant is prevalent in certain geographic regions.
key_quotes: Val30Met substitution is associated with isolated progressive polyneuropathy.
The highly variable penetrance of mutations in the TTR gene and ageing are other elements of heterogeneity.

tables_processed.table_caption: Characteristics of patients with amyloid cardiomyopathy due to wild type TTR and the two most diffuse variant TTR forms.

extraction_metadata.notes: Data was extracted thoroughly from the main text and tables.
